snippet: In the whimsical comedy “Jesus Henry Christ,” a child prodigy seeks out his biological father and denies the existence of God.
abstract: Stephen Holden reviews movie Jesus Henry Christ, written and directed by Dennis Lee; Jason Spevack and Toni Collette star. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: Henry James Herman (Jason Spevack), the protagonist and sometime narrator of Dennis Lee's absurdist comedy ''Jesus Henry Christ,'' is a 10-year-old prodigy with an IQ of 301 (the second-highest ever recorded, we're told) who began speaking at the age of 9 months. ''Everybody thinks I have a photographic memory, but that's not really accurate,'' he explains early in the movie. ''I'm more like a video camera. I record what I see. I always remember.''

headline.main: A Prodigy's Manifesto (Not on the Mount)
